English.answer: (A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically
choices: (A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically
(B) Commercial design should emphasize the relationship between advertising and products as much as possible
(C) Unique creativity is not an absolute element of commercial design
(D) For designers, attracting customers should be the first priority
English.context: Commercial design may be increasingly endowed with the value of artistic creation and appreciation, but its fundamental starting point and goal is always to show the characteristics of the product to customers in an artistic way. If a commercial design is not reminiscent of a product and likes it, no matter how exquisite and creative it is, it cannot be regarded as a successful design. In the final analysis, the most important thing about advertising besides creativity is relevance. We don't want to be attracted by a beautiful work, but we don't see any connection between it and the product we endorse.

In the final analysis, the most important thing about advertising besides creativity is relevance. We don't want to be attracted by a beautiful work, but we don't see any connection between it and the product we endorse.
Question:

(A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically
(B) Commercial design should emphasize the relationship between advertising and products as much as possible
(C) Unique creativity is not an absolute element of commercial design
(D) For designers, attracting customers should be the first priority
Answer:
English.model_prediction: A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically.

Filipino.answer: (A) Ang isang matagumpay na disenyo ay dapat na maipakita ang mga katangian ng produkto nang masining
choices: (A) Ang isang matagumpay na disenyo ay dapat na maipakita ang mga katangian ng produkto nang masining
(B) Dapat bigyang-diin ng komersyal na disenyo ang kaugnayan sa pagitan ng advertising at mga produkto hangga't maaari
(C) Ang natatanging pagkamalikhain ay hindi isang ganap na elemento ng komersyal na disenyo
(D) Para sa mga designer, ang pag-akit ng mga customer ay dapat ang unang priyoridad
Filipino.context: Ang komersyal na disenyo ay maaaring lalong pinagkalooban ng halaga ng masining na paglikha at pagpapahalaga, ngunit ang pangunahing panimulang punto at layunin nito ay palaging ipakita ang mga katangian ng produkto sa mga customer sa masining na paraan. Kung ang isang komersyal na disenyo ay hindi nakapagpapaalaala sa isang produkto at nagustuhan ito, gaano man ito kaganda at pagiging malikhain, hindi ito maaaring ituring na isang matagumpay na disenyo. Sa huling pagsusuri, ang pinakamahalagang bagay tungkol sa advertising bukod sa pagkamalikhain ay ang kaugnayan. Hindi namin gustong maakit sa isang magandang gawa, ngunit wala kaming nakikitang koneksyon sa pagitan nito at ng produktong ini-endorso namin.

Spanish.answer: (A) Un diseño exitoso debe ser capaz de mostrar artísticamente las características del producto.
choices: (A) Un diseño exitoso debe ser capaz de mostrar artísticamente las características del producto.
(B) El diseño comercial debe enfatizar al máximo la relación entre la publicidad y los productos.
(C) La creatividad única no es un elemento absoluto del diseño comercial.
(D) Para los diseñadores, atraer clientes debería ser la primera prioridad
Spanish.context: El diseño comercial puede estar cada vez más dotado del valor de creación y apreciación artística, pero su punto de partida y objetivo fundamental es siempre mostrar las características del producto a los clientes de forma artística. Si un diseño comercial no recuerda a un producto y le gusta, por muy exquisito y creativo que sea, no puede considerarse un diseño exitoso. En última instancia, lo más importante de la publicidad, además de la creatividad, es la relevancia. No queremos sentirnos atraídos por una obra hermosa, pero no vemos ninguna conexión entre ella y el producto que promocionamos.

Trong phân tích cuối cùng, điều quan trọng nhất của quảng cáo bên cạnh tính sáng tạo là tính phù hợp. English.answer: (A) The candidates in the election are taking positions on substantive policy issues.
choices: (A) The candidates in the election are taking positions on substantive policy issues.
(B) How the press reports politics determines the substantive issues in the campaign.

English.context: The press reports on political campaigns these days as if they were chess games. One candidate' s campaign advisor makes a move; the other candidate' s advisor makes a countermove. The press then reports on the campaign advisors and not on the candidates. The losers in this chess game are the voters. They are deprived of the information they need to make informed decisions because the press is ignoring substantive policy issues and reporting only on the process of the campaign. It is clear that the campaign advisors should stay out of the limelight and let the press report on the most revealing positions on substantive issues the candidates have taken.

Está claro que los asesores de campaña deben mantenerse fuera del foco de atención y dejar que la prensa informe sobre las posiciones más reveladoras sobre cuestiones de fondo que hayan adoptado los candidatos.

English.answer: (D) Adults do not contract influenza primarily from children who have influenza.
choices: (A) The injectable vaccine is affordable for all adults.

English.context: Until now, only injectable vaccines against influenza have been available. However, since children seldom develop serious complications from influenza, no significant public health benefit would result from widespread vaccination of children using the nasal spray.

Information anxiety refers to the boredom, irritability, nervousness and other negative emotions caused by people's difficulties in obtaining, processing and using the information they need.
Question:

Choices:
(A) After registering his intention to buy a house with the developer, Mr. Min receives dozens or even hundreds of phone calls and messages every day, selling, decorating, investing, managing money, and lending money. It annoys him a lot.
(B) Xiao Li looked up information in the foreign language database and jumped out of dozens of related papers every time he entered a keyword. Because of poor English, he was unable to screen. He had no idea what he really wanted to use. He felt that he was about to have a mental breakdown.
(C) Xiao Xie is addicted to online games and plays them all night. He always thinks about games in class during the day. Over time, he has a serious weariness of learning, his mental state is in the doldrums and his physical fitness is getting worse and worse.
(D) Xiaomin is keen on entertainment gossip. she keeps an eye on Weibo updates. When she sees the unread information on her phone, she can't help but want to click on it. She spends far more time browsing information every day than she does at work.

Options A, C, and D do not relate to the concept of information anxiety described in the passage.

Indonesian.context: Kontribusi terbesar Einstein bagi umat manusia adalah teori relativitas, yang merupakan alat ampuh bagi umat manusia untuk mempelajari alam semesta. Einstein menggunakan teori relativitas untuk menghitung massa alam semesta dan menemukan bahwa total massa alam semesta ternyata nol. Filipino.context: Ang luad ay maaaring mukhang hindi gaanong mataba, mas pinaghalong mineral, ngunit maaaring ito ang lugar ng kapanganakan ng buhay sa Earth. Sa nakalipas na bilyun-bilyong taon, ang mga kemikal na nakulong sa mga puwang na ito ay maaaring sumailalim sa mga kumplikadong reaksyon, na bumubuo ng mga protina, mga deoxyribonucleic acid at mga sistema na kalaunan ay bumubuo ng mga buhay na bula. Spanish.answer: (B) La vida en la Tierra puede originarse originalmente a partir de arcilla.
choices: (A) Efecto protector del hidrogel sobre reacciones bioquímicas.
(B) La vida en la Tierra puede originarse originalmente a partir de arcilla.
(C) El papel de la arcilla en el origen de la vida en la tierra
(D) La arcilla es rica en nutrientes necesarios para la vida.
Spanish.context: La arcilla puede parecer una mezcla menos fértil y más mineral, pero puede ser el lugar de nacimiento de la vida en la Tierra. En agua de mar antigua simulada, la arcilla forma hidrogeles, formados por espacios diminutos (como esponjas) que absorben líquidos. Durante los últimos miles de millones de años, las sustancias químicas atrapadas en estos espacios pueden haber sufrido reacciones complejas, formando proteínas, ácidos desoxirribonucleicos y sistemas que eventualmente forman burbujas vivas. Los hidrogeles formados por la arcilla pueden aprisionar y proteger los procesos químicos anteriores hasta que se desarrolle la membrana celular que encierra las vesículas vivas.

La arcilla puede parecer una mezcla menos fértil y más mineral, pero puede ser el lugar de nacimiento de la vida en la Tierra. En agua de mar antigua simulada, la arcilla forma hidrogeles, formados por espacios diminutos (como esponjas) que absorben líquidos. Durante los últimos miles de millones de años, las sustancias químicas atrapadas en estos espacios pueden haber sufrido reacciones complejas, formando proteínas, ácidos desoxirribonucleicos y sistemas que eventualmente forman burbujas vivas. Los hidrogeles formados por la arcilla pueden aprisionar y proteger los procesos químicos anteriores hasta que se desarrolle la membrana celular que encierra las vesículas vivas.

(D) La arcilla es rica en nutrientes necesarios para la vida.
Answer:
Spanish.model_prediction: The correct answer is (C) The role of clay in the origin of life on Earth.

English.answer: (D) In general scientific research is not referred to in journals until the research is completed.

English.context: More and more academic institutions are using citation analysis as the main technique for measuring the quality of scientific research. This technique involves a yearly scanning of scientific journals to count the number of references to a researcher' s work. Indonesian.context: Para ilmuwan percaya bahwa penyerapan karbon dioksida dari atmosfer oleh lautan untuk sementara mengurangi peningkatan konsentrasi karbon dioksida, dan ketika penurunan tersebut berakhir, konsentrasi karbon dioksida di atmosfer akan meningkat lebih cepat. Jadi apakah peningkatan karbon dioksida akan menyebabkan kenaikan suhu atmosfer? Meskipun sebagian besar ilmuwan percaya bahwa jawabannya adalah ya, hal ini merupakan proses yang panjang dengan banyak variabel, dan para skeptis terhadap perubahan iklim telah berusaha meyakinkan masyarakat bahwa tingkat karbon dioksida tidak selalu berhubungan dengan suhu atmosfer. Strategi ini sangat efektif sehingga banyak orang masih menolak untuk percaya bahwa aktivitas manusia menyebabkan pemanasan global dan oleh karena itu menolak untuk berpartisipasi dalam pengurangan emisi.

English.answer: (A) Human activities are the main cause of global warming
choices: (A) Human activities are the main cause of global warming
(B) The oceans are becoming less capable of absorbing carbon dioxide
(C) Climate change has little to do with co2 concentrations
(D) Human activity can lead to an increase in carbon dioxide concentrations
English.context: Scientists believe that the absorption of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by the oceans temporarily eased the rise in carbon dioxide concentrations, and that once the relief lapses, atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations will increase even faster. So will the increased carbon dioxide lead to a rise in atmospheric temperatures? Although most scientists believe the answer is yes, it is a long process with many variables, and climate change skeptics have been trying to convince the public that carbon dioxide levels are not necessarily related to atmospheric temperature. This strategy was so effective that many people still refuse to believe that human activity is causing global warming and therefore refuse to participate in reducing emissions.

Filipino.answer: (A) Ang mga gawain ng tao ang pangunahing sanhi ng global warming
choices: (A) Ang mga gawain ng tao ang pangunahing sanhi ng global warming

(C) Ang pagbabago ng klima ay walang gaanong kinalaman sa mga konsentrasyon ng co2
(D) Ang aktibidad ng tao ay maaaring humantong sa pagtaas ng mga konsentrasyon ng carbon dioxide
Filipino.context: Naniniwala ang mga siyentipiko na ang pagsipsip ng carbon dioxide mula sa atmospera ng mga karagatan ay pansamantalang nagpapagaan sa pagtaas ng mga konsentrasyon ng carbon dioxide, at na kapag nawala ang relief, ang mga konsentrasyon ng carbon dioxide sa atmospera ay tataas nang mas mabilis. Kaya ang tumaas na carbon dioxide ay hahantong sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera? Bagama't ang karamihan sa mga siyentipiko ay naniniwala na ang sagot ay oo, ito ay isang mahabang proseso na may maraming mga variable, at ang mga nag-aalinlangan sa pagbabago ng klima ay sinusubukang kumbinsihin ang publiko na ang mga antas ng carbon dioxide ay hindi kinakailangang nauugnay sa temperatura ng atmospera. Napakabisa ng diskarteng ito kaya marami pa ring tao ang tumatangging maniwala na ang aktibidad ng tao ay nagdudulot ng global warming at samakatuwid ay tumatangging lumahok sa pagbabawas ng mga emisyon.

Spanish.answer: (A) Las actividades humanas son la principal causa del calentamiento global
choices: (A) Las actividades humanas son la principal causa del calentamiento global
(B) Los océanos son cada vez menos capaces de absorber dióxido de carbono
(C) El cambio climático tiene poco que ver con las concentraciones de co2
(D) La actividad humana puede provocar un aumento de las concentraciones de dióxido de carbono
Spanish.context: Los científicos creen que la absorción de dióxido de carbono de la atmósfera por los océanos alivió temporalmente el aumento de las concentraciones de dióxido de carbono, y que una vez que pase el alivio, las concentraciones de dióxido de carbono atmosférico aumentarán aún más rápido. Entonces, ¿el aumento de dióxido de carbono conducirá a un aumento de las temperaturas atmosféricas? Aunque la mayoría de los científicos creen que la respuesta es sí, es un proceso largo con muchas variables, y los escépticos del cambio climático han estado tratando de convencer al público de que los niveles de dióxido de carbono no están necesariamente relacionados con la temperatura atmosférica. Esta estrategia fue tan efectiva que muchas personas todavía se niegan a creer que la actividad humana esté causando el calentamiento global y, por lo tanto, se niegan a participar en la reducción de emisiones.

Chinese.answer: (A) 人类活动是导致全球变暖的主要原因
choices: (A) 人类活动是导致全球变暖的主要原因

Option (D) is partially correct, but it doesn't capture the specific concern with plastic beverage bottles.

Spanish.answer: (D) Las bebidas en el coche durante mucho tiempo en verano son una amenaza potencial para la salud
choices: (A) Las botellas de bebidas desechables contienen carcinógenos
(B) Cómo evitar el deterioro de las bebidas en los coches en verano
(C) Los conductores deben reponer la humedad corporal a tiempo cuando conducen en verano.

Spanish.context: Con las altas temperaturas y el calor del verano, el agua se ha convertido en una necesidad para aliviar el calor del verano. Pero para los automovilistas, las bebidas de larga duración en vagones calientes y bochornosos son una amenaza potencial para la salud. Las botellas de bebidas hechas de plástico son seguras de usar una vez y corren el riesgo de sufrir cáncer si se reutilizan. Estas botellas de bebidas se pueden mantener a temperatura ambiente durante mucho tiempo, pero si se exponen al sol, el material envejecerá y liberará sustancias tóxicas, y las personas tendrán reacciones tóxicas crónicas como náuseas y vómitos después de beber las bebidas en las botellas.

English.answer: (B) The human brain has advantages that computers do not have
choices: (A) The ability of computers can easily lead to the idea that computers are superior to human brains

English.context: There are two differences between brain and computer, one is easy to forget, the other is easy to make mistakes. This seems to be a disadvantage, but in fact it is an advantage. Forgetting happens automatically, which allows us to clear out excess information without effort, making room for unexpected good ideas. If there is no such space, good ideas will fly into the dark because they can't find habitat. Making relationships go wrong is a wonderful gift of the human brain, with which we often make unexpected discoveries and encounter new ideas where there is no connection. These two differences illustrate the same thing, that is, the ability of the computer is only up to information, while the ability of the human brain is to let information lead to thought.

Filipino.context: Mayroong dalawang pagkakaiba sa pagitan ng utak at computer, ang isa ay madaling makalimutan, ang isa ay madaling magkamali. Awtomatikong nangyayari ang pagkalimot, na nagbibigay-daan sa amin na alisin ang labis na impormasyon nang walang pagsisikap, na nagbibigay ng puwang para sa hindi inaasahang magagandang ideya. Kung walang ganoong espasyo, ang magagandang ideya ay lilipad sa dilim dahil hindi sila makahanap ng tirahan. Ang pagkakamali sa mga relasyon ay isang magandang regalo ng utak ng tao, kung saan madalas tayong nakakagawa ng mga hindi inaasahang pagtuklas at nakakatagpo ng mga bagong ideya kung saan walang koneksyon. Ang dalawang pagkakaibang ito ay naglalarawan ng parehong bagay, iyon ay, ang kakayahan ng computer ay hanggang sa impormasyon lamang, habang ang kakayahan ng utak ng tao ay hayaan ang impormasyon na humantong sa pag-iisip.

Spanish.context: Hay dos diferencias entre el cerebro y la computadora: una es fácil de olvidar y la otra es fácil de cometer errores. Esto parece ser una desventaja, pero en realidad es una ventaja. El olvido ocurre automáticamente, lo que nos permite eliminar el exceso de información sin esfuerzo, dejando espacio para buenas ideas inesperadas. Si no existe ese espacio, las buenas ideas volarán hacia la oscuridad porque no pueden encontrar un hábitat. Hacer que las relaciones salgan mal es un maravilloso regalo del cerebro humano, con el que a menudo hacemos descubrimientos inesperados y encontramos nuevas ideas donde no hay conexión. Estas dos diferencias ilustran lo mismo, es decir, la capacidad de la computadora sólo depende de la información, mientras que la capacidad del cerebro humano es dejar que la información conduzca al pensamiento.

Malay.answer: (B) Otak manusia mempunyai kelebihan yang tidak dimiliki oleh komputer

(C) Kelupaan adalah kelebihan otak manusia
(D) Kekeliruan adalah anugerah indah otak manusia
Malay.context: Ada dua perbezaan antara otak dan komputer, satu mudah lupa, satu lagi mudah melakukan kesilapan. Ini seolah-olah satu kelemahan, tetapi sebenarnya ia adalah satu kelebihan. Kelupaan berlaku secara automatik, yang membolehkan kita memmbuang maklumat berlebihan tanpa usaha, sambil memberi ruang untuk idea bagus yang tidak terjangka. Jika tiada ruang sedemikian, idea yang baik akan terbang ke dalam kegelapan kerana mereka tidak dapat mencari tempat tinggal. Menjadikan perhubungan salah adalah anugerah otak manusia yang indah, yang dengannya kita sering membuat penemuan yang tidak terjangka dan menemui idea baharu yang tiada kaitan. Kedua-dua perbezaan ini menggambarkan perkara yang sama, iaitu keupayaan komputer hanya terpulang kepada maklumat, manakala keupayaan otak manusia adalah membiarkan maklumat membawa kepada pemikiran.

Vietnamese.context: Có hai điểm khác biệt giữa bộ não và máy tính, một là dễ quên, hai là dễ mắc lỗi. Điều này tưởng chừng như là một bất lợi nhưng thực chất lại là một lợi thế. Việc quên xảy ra một cách tự động, điều này cho phép chúng ta loại bỏ thông tin dư thừa mà không cần nỗ lực, nhường chỗ cho những ý tưởng hay bất ngờ. Nếu không có không gian đó, những ý tưởng hay sẽ bay vào bóng tối vì không tìm được môi trường sống. Hai điểm khác biệt này minh họa cho một điều giống nhau, đó là khả năng của máy tính chỉ phụ thuộc vào thông tin, trong khi khả năng của bộ não con người là để thông tin dẫn đến suy nghĩ.

English.answer: (C) New machines and technologies can enslave as well as liberate us.
choices: (A) Most new machines and technologies make our lives more synchronized and productive.
(B) Some new machines and technologies bring no improvement to our lives.
(C) New machines and technologies can enslave as well as liberate us.

English.context: When machines are invented and technologies are developed, they alter the range of choices open to us. The clock, for example, made possible the synchronization of human affairs, which resulted in an increase in productivity. At the same time that the clock opened up some avenues, it closed others. It has become harder and harder to live except by the clock, so that now people have no choice in the matter at all.

Indonesian.answer: (C) Membatasi kenaikan suhu atmosfer setidaknya akan memberikan waktu bagi terumbu karang untuk beradaptasi.
choices: (A) Pemanasan global telah menyebabkan pengapuran sistem terumbu karang lepas pantai semakin lambat.
(B) Meningkatnya suhu dan tekanan menyebabkan karang dangkal mencari perlindungan di perairan yang lebih dalam.
(C) Membatasi kenaikan suhu atmosfer setidaknya akan memberikan waktu bagi terumbu karang untuk beradaptasi.
(D) Kenaikan suhu yang terus menerus akan menyebabkan interval kejadian albino semakin lama.
Indonesian.context: Saat ini, kenaikan suhu air laut telah memicu serangkaian peristiwa pemutihan karang. Para peneliti sangat khawatir dengan nasib karang global. Para peneliti telah menemukan bahwa zooxanthellae dapat menggunakan fotosintesis untuk menghasilkan nutrisi yang dibutuhkan oleh dirinya sendiri dan inangnya. Ketika suhu air laut yang tinggi menyebabkan terumbu karang mengeluarkan alga simbiosis yang disebut zooxanthellae, karang yang kehilangan warna alga tersebut lambat laun berubah menjadi putih, dan terjadilah albinisme. Jika albinisme terus berlanjut, satu-satunya hal yang menunggu terumbu karang adalah kematian.

English.answer: (C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt.
choices: (A) Global warming has led to the calcification of offshore coral reef systems more and more slowly.
(B) Rising temperatures and pressures cause shallow coral to seek refuge in deeper waters.
(C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt.
(D) The continuous rise of temperature will lead to the longer and longer interval of albino events.
English.context: At present, the rise of sea water temperature has triggered a series of bleaching events. Researchers are very worried about the fate of global corals. Researchers have found that zooxanthellae can use photosynthesis to produce nutrients required by themselves and their hosts. When the high temperature sea water causes coral reefs to discharge symbiotic algae called zooxanthellae, corals that lose color algae gradually turn white, and albinism occurs. If albinism continues, the only thing waiting for the coral reef is death.
English.question: From this, which of the following can be inferred?
English.model_input:
Solve the multi-choice question by selecting the accurate answer.
Context:
At present, the rise of sea water temperature has triggered a series of bleaching events. Researchers are very worried about the fate of global corals. Researchers have found that zooxanthellae can use photosynthesis to produce nutrients required by themselves and their hosts. When the high temperature sea water causes coral reefs to discharge symbiotic algae called zooxanthellae, corals that lose color algae gradually turn white, and albinism occurs. If albinism continues, the only thing waiting for the coral reef is death.
Question:
From this, which of the following can be inferred?
Choices:
(A) Global warming has led to the calcification of offshore coral reef systems more and more slowly.
(B) Rising temperatures and pressures cause shallow coral to seek refuge in deeper waters.
(C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt.
(D) The continuous rise of temperature will lead to the longer and longer interval of albino events.
Answer:
English.model_prediction: The correct answer is (C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt. This inference can be made from the context where it is mentioned that researchers are worried about the fate of global corals due to the rise in sea water temperature triggering bleaching events. It also states that if albinism continues, the only thing waiting for the coral reef is death. Therefore, limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature would give coral reefs some time to adapt before they succumb to the effects of rising temperatures. Options A, B, and D are not supported by the given context.

Filipino.answer: (C) Ang paglilimita sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera ay mag-iiwan ng ilang oras upang umangkop ang mga coral reef.
choices: (A) Ang global warming ay humantong sa pag-calcification ng mga offshore coral reef system nang mas mabagal.
(B) Ang tumataas na temperatura at pressure ay nagiging sanhi ng mga mababaw na coral upang maghanap ng kanlungan sa mas malalim na tubig.
(C) Ang paglilimita sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera ay mag-iiwan ng ilang oras upang umangkop ang mga coral reef.
(D) Ang patuloy na pagtaas ng temperatura ay hahantong sa mas mahabang pagitan ng mga pagkaroon ng albinism.
Filipino.context: Sa kasalukuyan, ang pagtaas ng temperatura ng tubig sa dagat ay nag-trigger ng isang serye ng mga kaganapan sa pagpapaputi. Ang mga mananaliksik ay labis na nag-aalala tungkol sa kapalaran ng mga pandaigdigang korales. Natuklasan ng mga mananaliksik na ang zooxanthellae ay maaaring gumamit ng photosynthesis upang makagawa ng mga sustansyang kailangan ng kanilang sarili at ng kanilang mga host. Kapag ang mataas na temperatura ng tubig sa dagat ay nagiging sanhi ng pagpapalabas ng mga coral reef ng symbiotic algae na tinatawag na zooxanthellae, ang mga coral na nawawalan ng kulay na algae ay unti-unting pumuputi, at nangyayari ang albinism. Kung magpapatuloy ang albinism, ang tanging naghihintay sa coral reef ay kamatayan.

Kapag ang mataas na temperatura ng tubig sa dagat ay nagiging sanhi ng pagpapalabas ng mga coral reef ng symbiotic algae na tinatawag na zooxanthellae, ang mga coral na nawawalan ng kulay na algae ay unti-unting pumuputi, at nangyayari ang albinism. (B) Ang tumataas na temperatura at pressure ay nagiging sanhi ng mga mababaw na coral upang maghanap ng kanlungan sa mas malalim na tubig.
(C) Ang paglilimita sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera ay mag-iiwan ng ilang oras upang umangkop ang mga coral reef.

Answer:

This suggests that the continuous rise in temperature is causing the coral to become white due to the absence of zooxanthellae, which are responsible for producing the pigments that give corals their color. Los investigadores han descubierto que las zooxantelas pueden utilizar la fotosíntesis para producir los nutrientes que necesitan ellas y sus huéspedes. Cuando el agua de mar a alta temperatura hace que los arrecifes de coral liberen algas simbióticas llamadas zooxantelas, los corales que pierden el color de las algas se vuelven blancos gradualmente y se produce albinismo. Si el albinismo continúa, lo único que le espera al arrecife de coral es la muerte.

Indonesian.answer: (A) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan membandingkan gaya hidup dan karakteristik kepribadian penderita-penderita tumor ganas dengan orang sehat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko pemicu timbulnya tumor.
choices: (A) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan membandingkan gaya hidup dan karakteristik kepribadian penderita-penderita tumor ganas dengan orang sehat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko pemicu timbulnya tumor.
(B) Para peneliti-peneliti mengurutkan DNA sel-sel tumor dan sel-sel sehat dari setiap pasien untuk mengidentifikasi mutasi spesifik tumor dan mengidentifikasi protein abnormal terkait
(C) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan menggunakan imunoterapi untuk mencoba mengubah sel-sel T kekebalan yang tidak berefek terhadap sel-sel tumor dan membuat mereka kembali ke medan perang
(D) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan menggunakan tikus untuk menguji dan menyuntikkan protein abnormal tumor yang diekstraksi ke tikus sebagai vaksin untuk merangsang dan meningkatkan respons kekebalan mereka
Indonesian.context: Akibat mutasi gen, sel berkembang biak dan berdiferensiasi secara tidak terkendali, dan akhirnya berkembang menjadi tumor-tumor ganas. Ada banyak protein-protein abnormal yang dikodekan oleh gen-gen mutan pada permukaan sel-sel kanker. Masuk akal untuk dikatakan bahwa protein-protein abnormal ini harus dikenali oleh sistem kekebalan tubuh pada waktunya, dan memicu respons imun untuk menghilangkan sel kanker dalam satu pukulan. Namun karena pesatnya perkembangan sel tumor, mereka sangat pandai berkamuflase, apalagi mereka terus bermutasi. Di hadapan sel-sel tumor yang ganas dan banyak akal, sel-sel kekebalan yang semula kuat tampaknya tidak mampu dan bahkan menutup mata terhadap beberapa sel-sel tumor. Imunosupresi yang terbentuk di lingkungan mikro tumor membuat sistem kekebalan tubuh lumpuh.

Question:

Choices:
(A) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan membandingkan gaya hidup dan karakteristik kepribadian penderita-penderita tumor ganas dengan orang sehat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko pemicu timbulnya tumor.

English.answer: (A) Scientists compare the lifestyle and personality characteristics of patients with malignant tumors with those of healthy people to find out the risk factors inducing tumor incidence
choices: (A) Scientists compare the lifestyle and personality characteristics of patients with malignant tumors with those of healthy people to find out the risk factors inducing tumor incidence
(B) The researchers sequenced the DNA of tumor cells and healthy cells of each patient to identify tumor specific mutations and identify related abnormal proteins
(C) Scientists use immunotherapy to try to transform immune T cells that are indifferent to tumor cells and make them return to the battlefield
(D) Scientists used mice to test and injected the extracted tumor abnormal protein into mice as a vaccine to stimulate and enhance their immune response
English.context: Due to gene mutation, cells proliferate and differentiate uncontrollably, and eventually develop into malignant tumors. There are many abnormal proteins encoded by mutant genes on the surface of cancer cells. It is reasonable to say that these abnormal proteins should be recognized by the body's immune system in time, and trigger an immune response to remove cancer cells at one stroke. However, due to the rapid development of tumor cells, they are very good at camouflage, Moreover, it is constantly mutated. In the face of fierce and resourceful tumor cells, the originally powerful immune cells seem to be unable and even turn a blind eye to some tumor cells. The immunosuppression formed in the tumor microenvironment makes the immune system paralyzed.
English.question: According to the above information, which of the following studies may contribute to the development of effective antitumor drugs?
English.model_input:
Solve the multi-choice question by selecting the accurate answer.
Context:
Due to gene mutation, cells proliferate and differentiate uncontrollably, and eventually develop into malignant tumors. There are many abnormal proteins encoded by mutant genes on the surface of cancer cells. It is reasonable to say that these abnormal proteins should be recognized by the body's immune system in time, and trigger an immune response to remove cancer cells at one stroke. However, due to the rapid development of tumor cells, they are very good at camouflage, Moreover, it is constantly mutated. In the face of fierce and resourceful tumor cells, the originally powerful immune cells seem to be unable and even turn a blind eye to some tumor cells. The immunosuppression formed in the tumor microenvironment makes the immune system paralyzed.
Question:
According to the above information, which of the following studies may contribute to the development of effective antitumor drugs?
Choices:
(A) Scientists compare the lifestyle and personality characteristics of patients with malignant tumors with those of healthy people to find out the risk factors inducing tumor incidence
(B) The researchers sequenced the DNA of tumor cells and healthy cells of each patient to identify tumor specific mutations and identify related abnormal proteins
(C) Scientists use immunotherapy to try to transform immune T cells that are indifferent to tumor cells and make them return to the battlefield
(D) Scientists used mice to test and injected the extracted tumor abnormal protein into mice as a vaccine to stimulate and enhance their immune response
Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (C) Scientists use immunotherapy to try to transform immune T cells that are indifferent to tumor cells and make them return to the battlefield.

Immunotherapy involves using the body's own immune system to fight off cancer. By targeting the immune system, scientists can help train the immune system to recognize and attack cancer cells more effectively. This approach has shown promising results in clinical trials for certain types of cancer. Therefore, option C is the most appropriate choice for contributing to the development of effective antitumor drugs.

Filipino.answer: (A) Inihambing ng mga siyentipiko ang mga katangian ng pamumuhay at personalidad ng mga pasyenteng may malignant na mga tumor sa mga malulusog na tao upang malaman ang mga kadahilanan ng panganib na nagdudulot ng insidente ng tumor
choices: (A) Inihambing ng mga siyentipiko ang mga katangian ng pamumuhay at personalidad ng mga pasyenteng may malignant na mga tumor sa mga malulusog na tao upang malaman ang mga kadahilanan ng panganib na nagdudulot ng insidente ng tumor

(B) Inayos ng mga mananaliksik ang DNA ng mga tumor cell at malusog na mga selula ng bawat pasyente upang matukoy ang mga partikular na mutasyon ng tumor at matukoy ang mga nauugnay na abnormal na protina.
(C) Gumagamit ang mga siyentipiko ng immunotherapy upang subukang baguhin ang mga immune T cells na walang malasakit sa mga selula ng tumor at ibalik ang mga ito sa mabuting kundisyon.

(D) Ginamit ng mga siyentipiko ang mga daga upang subukan at i-inject ang nakuhang tumor na abnormal na protina sa mga daga bilang isang bakuna upang pasiglahin at pahusayin ang kanilang immune response
Filipino.context: Dahil sa mutation ng gene, ang mga selula ay dumarami at hindi makontrol ang pagkakaiba, at kalaunan ay nagiging malignant na mga tumor. Maraming abnormal na protina na naka-encode sa mutant genes sa ibabaw ng mga selula ng kanser. Makatuwirang sabihin na ang mga abnormal na protinang ito ay dapat na makilala ng immune system ng katawan sa tamang panahon, at mag-trigger ng immune response upang tiyaking alisin ang mga selula ng kanser. Gayunpaman, dahil sa mabilis na pag-unlad ng mga selula ng tumor, ang mga ito ay napakahusay sa pagbabalatkayo, Bukod dito, ito ay patuloy na nagbabago. Sa harap ng mabangis at mapamaraang mga selulang tumor, ang orihinal na makapangyarihang mga selulang immune ay tila hindi kaya at pinag-wawalang bahala ang ilang mga selulang tumor. Ang immunosuppression na nabuo sa tumor microenvironment ay nakakalumpo sa immune system.

Spanish.answer: (A) Los científicos comparan el estilo de vida y las características de personalidad de pacientes con tumores malignos con los de personas sanas para descubrir los factores de riesgo que inducen la incidencia de tumores
choices: (A) Los científicos comparan el estilo de vida y las características de personalidad de pacientes con tumores malignos con los de personas sanas para descubrir los factores de riesgo que inducen la incidencia de tumores

(B) Los investigadores secuenciaron el ADN de las células tumorales y de las células sanas de cada paciente para identificar mutaciones específicas del tumor e identificar proteínas anormales relacionadas.
(C) Los científicos utilizan la inmunoterapia para intentar transformar las células T inmunes que son indiferentes a las células tumorales y hacerlas regresar al campo de batalla
(D) Los científicos utilizaron ratones para probar e inyectaron la proteína anormal del tumor extraída en ratones como vacuna para estimular y mejorar su respuesta inmune.
Spanish.context: Debido a la mutación genética, las células proliferan y se diferencian sin control y, finalmente, se convierten en tumores malignos. Hay muchas proteínas anormales codificadas por genes mutantes en la superficie de las células cancerosas. Es razonable decir que estas proteínas anormales deberían ser reconocidas por el sistema inmunológico del cuerpo a tiempo y desencadenar una respuesta inmune para eliminar las células cancerosas de una sola vez. Sin embargo, debido al rápido desarrollo de las células tumorales, son muy buenas para camuflarse y, además, mutan constantemente. Frente a las células tumorales feroces e ingeniosas, las células inmunes originalmente poderosas parecen incapaces e incluso hacen la vista gorda ante algunas células tumorales. La inmunosupresión formada en el microambiente del tumor paraliza el sistema inmunológico.

Chinese.answer: (A) 科学家将恶性肿瘤患者和健康人的生活方式,个性特征进行对照研究,找出诱发肿瘤发病的风险因素
choices: (A) 科学家将恶性肿瘤患者和健康人的生活方式,个性特征进行对照研究,找出诱发肿瘤发病的风险因素
(B) 研究人员对每位患者的肿瘤细胞和健康细胞的DNA进行测序,以鉴定出肿瘤特异性突变,并确定相关的异常蛋白
(C) 科学家利用免疫疗法,试图改造对肿瘤细胞"不上心"的免疫T细胞,使其重返战场
(D) 科学家利用小鼠进行试验,将提取的肿瘤异常蛋白作为疫苗注射入小鼠体内,激发并增强其免疫反应
Chinese.context: 细胞因为发生了基因突变,出现不受控制地增殖分化,最终发展成为恶性肿瘤.在癌细胞表面存在着许多由突变基因编码的异常蛋白,按理说,这些异常蛋白应该被机体免疫系统及时识别,并引发免疫反应将癌细胞一举清除.然而,由于肿瘤细胞发展迅速,极善伪装,而且不断突变,面对凶猛机智的肿瘤细胞,原本强大的免疫细胞也显得有些"力不从心",甚至还会对一些肿瘤细胞"视而不见".在肿瘤微环境中形成的免疫抑制,更是让免疫系统陷入"瘫痪".

Proteins provide scaffolds and produce energy, while DNA and RNA preserve and implement replication drawings of the population, and phospholipid molecules and proteins work together to build cell membranes. English.answer: (D) Without the support of large corporate sponsors, opera companies could not afford to produce any but the most famous of operas.
choices: (A) Large corporate sponsors will stop supporting opera productions if they are denied control over which operas will be produced.
(B) The reduction of opera production budgets would not reduce the desire of large corporate sponsors to support operas.
(C) A few opera ticket purchasers go to the opera for the sake of going to the opera, not to see specific operatic productions.
(D) Without the support of large corporate sponsors, opera companies could not afford to produce any but the most famous of operas.
English.context: The high cost of production is severely limiting which operas are available to the public. These costs necessitate reliance on large corporate sponsors, who in return demand that only the most famous operas be produced. Determining which operas will be produced should rest only with ticket purchasers at the box office, not with large corporate sponsors. If we reduce production budgets so that operas can be supported exclusively by box-office receipts and donations from individuals, then the public will be able to see less famous operas.

Indonesian.answer: (A) Menunjukkan faktor-faktor yang mempengaruhi efek pencitraan ponsel
choices: (A) Menunjukkan faktor-faktor yang mempengaruhi efek pencitraan ponsel
(B) Memperkenalkan teknik-teknik untuk meningkatkan efek fotografi ponsel
(C) Jelaskan definisi piksel dan cara membuatnya menjadi lebih baik
(D) Mengungkapkan hubungan antara jumlah cahaya yang masuk dan nilai piksel
Indonesian.context: Saat menilai fungsi kamera untuk sebuah ponsel, secara intuitif orang selalu percaya bahwa semakin tinggi piksel kamera ponsel, semakin baik efek kameranya. Apakah ini benar? Dari prinsip pencitraan, besar kecilnya nilai piksel akan mempunyai pengaruh tertentu terhadap gambar yang dihasilkan. Jika luas dari sensor gambar dari ponsel tertentu telah diketahui, semakin tinggi nilai pikselnya, semakin kecil luas satuan pikselnya. Luas satuan piksel secara langsung mempengaruhi jumlah cahaya yang masuk. Semakin kecil area satuan piksel, semakin sedikit cahaya yang masuk ke sensor gambar, dan foto yang diambil akan menjadi gelap dan buram; semakin rendah nilai pikselnya, semakin besar area fotosensitif piksel satuan dan semakin baik kinerja fotosensitifnya. Bagus, sehingga untuk memiliki performa yang lebih baik dalam sensitivitas tinggi kualitas gambar dan tingkat pencitraan gambar.

English.answer: (A) Point out the factors that affect the imaging effect of mobile phones
choices: (A) Point out the factors that affect the imaging effect of mobile phones
(B) Introduce techniques to improve the effect of mobile phone photography
(C) Explain the definition of pixel and how to improve it
(D) Reveal the relationship between the amount of incoming light and the pixel value
English.context: When judging the camera function of a mobile phone, people always intuitively believe that the higher the pixel of the mobile phone, the better the camera effect. Is this really the case? From the imaging principle, the size of the pixel value will have a certain influence on the generated image. When the image sensor area of the mobile phone is certain, the higher the pixel value, the smaller the unit pixel area. The unit pixel area directly affects the amount of light entering. The smaller the unit pixel area, the less light entering the image sensor, and the captured photos will become dark and blurry; the lower the pixel value, the larger the unit pixel photosensitive area and the better the photosensitive performance. Good, so it has better performance in terms of high-sensitivity image quality and picture level of imaging.

Kapag tiyak ang image sensor area ng mobile phone, mas mataas ang pixel value, mas maliit ang unit pixel area. Direktang nakakaapekto ang unit pixel area sa dami ng pumapasok na liwanag. Kung mas maliit ang lugar ng pixel ng unit, mas kaunting liwanag ang pumapasok sa sensor ng imahe, at magiging madilim at malabo ang mga nakunan na larawan; mas mababa ang pixel value, mas malaki ang unit pixel photosensitive area at mas maganda ang photosensitive na performance. Mabuti, kaya ito ay may mas mahusay na pagganap sa mga tuntunin ng mataas na sensitivity na kalidad ng imahe at antas ng larawan ng imaging.

Spanish.answer: (A) Señale los factores que afectan el efecto de imagen de los teléfonos móviles.
choices: (A) Señale los factores que afectan el efecto de imagen de los teléfonos móviles.
(B) Introducir técnicas para mejorar el efecto de la fotografía con teléfonos móviles.
(C) Explica la definición de píxel y cómo mejorarlo.
(D) Revelar la relación entre la cantidad de luz entrante y el valor de píxel
Spanish.context: Al juzgar la función de la cámara de un teléfono móvil, la gente siempre cree intuitivamente que cuanto mayor sea el píxel del teléfono móvil, mejor será el efecto de la cámara. ¿Es este realmente el caso? Desde el principio de la imagen, el tamaño del valor del píxel tendrá cierta influencia en la imagen generada. Cuando el área del sensor de imagen del teléfono móvil es cierta, cuanto mayor sea el valor de píxel, menor será la unidad de área de píxel. El área unitaria de píxeles afecta directamente la cantidad de luz que ingresa. Cuanto más pequeña sea la unidad de área de píxeles, menos luz entrará en el sensor de imagen y las fotografías capturadas se volverán oscuras y borrosas; cuanto menor sea el valor de píxel, mayor será el área fotosensible por unidad de píxel y mejor será el rendimiento fotosensible. Bien, por lo que tiene un mejor rendimiento en términos de calidad de imagen de alta sensibilidad y nivel de imagen.

Chinese.answer: (A) 指出影响手机成像效果的因素
choices: (A) 指出影响手机成像效果的因素
(B) 介绍提高手机拍照效果的技巧
(C) 阐述像素的定义及其提升途径
(D) 揭示进光量与像素值间的关系
Chinese.context: 人们在评判手机拍照功能时，总是直观地认为手机像素越高，拍照效果越好。事实真的是这样吗？从成像原理来看，像素值的大小对生成的图像会产生一定的影响。当手机的图像传感器面积一定的时候，像素值越高，单位像素面积就越小。而单位像素面积又直接影响到进光量，单位像素面积越小，图像传感器上进光量就越少，拍摄出的照片就会变得灰暗模糊；像素值越低，单位像素感光面积大，感光性能更好，因此在成像的高感光画质以及画面层次等方面都有更好的表现。

Malay.answer: (A) Tunjukkan faktor yang mempengaruhi kesan pengimejan telefon bimbit
choices: (A) Tunjukkan faktor yang mempengaruhi kesan pengimejan telefon bimbit
(B) Perkenalkan teknik untuk meningkatkan kesan fotografi telefon bimbit
(C) Terangkan pentakrifan piksel dan cara memperbaikinya
(D) Dedahkan hubungan antara jumlah cahaya masuk dan nilai piksel
Malay.context: Apabila menilai fungsi kamera telefon bimbit, orang sentiasa percaya secara intuitif bahawa semakin tinggi piksel sebuah telefon bimbit, semakin baik kesan kameranya. Adakah ini benar? Daripada prinsip pengimejan, saiz nilai piksel akan mempunyai pengaruh tertentu terhadap imej yang dihasilkan. Apabila kawasan penderia imej telefon bimbit pasti, semakin tinggi nilai piksel, semakin kecil kawasan satu piksel unit. Kawasan piksel unit mempengaruhi jumlah cahaya yang masuk secara langsung. Semakin kecil kawasan piksel unit, semakin kurang cahaya yang memasuki penderia imej, dan foto yang ditangkap akan menjadi gelap dan kabur; semakin rendah nilai piksel, semakin besar kawasan fotosensitif piksel unit dan semakin baik prestasi fotosensitif. Bagus, jadi ia mempunyai prestasi yang lebih baik dari segi kualiti imej kepekaan tinggi dan tahap pengimejan gambar.

Spanish.context: Si no hay rayos, los seres humanos perderemos a un limpiador que trabaja duro. Cuando los rayos actúan, parte del oxígeno de la atmósfera se transforma en ozono. La alta temperatura generada en el proceso de los rayos puede matar más del 90% de las bacterias y microorganismos de la atmósfera, esto hace que el aire sea más puro, fresco y agradable.

English.answer: (A) Information technology has changed the way of knowledge accumulation and storage in the past
choices: (A) Information technology has changed the way of knowledge accumulation and storage in the past
(B) The memory function of the brain is no longer important in the Internet age
(C) Cloud computing will make human beings no longer the only owner of knowledge
(D) The classic way of knowledge accumulation will be replaced by Internet storage
English.context: Online search of information rather than encyclopedic knowledge storage is becoming the norm of knowledge production. The previous attempt to store knowledge in the brain through individual memory has been defeated in the face of the Internet way of unlimited storage of information, including cloud computing. With the externalization of the substitution and extraction of human memory ability by the Internet, people are no longer the owner of pure knowledge, but the creator and holder of new knowledge-all classical knowledge accumulation is prepared for the creation and possession of new knowledge.

Spanish.answer: (A) La tecnología de la información ha cambiado la forma de acumulación y almacenamiento de conocimiento en el pasado.
choices: (A) La tecnología de la información ha cambiado la forma de acumulación y almacenamiento de conocimiento en el pasado.
(B) La función de memoria del cerebro ya no es importante en la era de Internet
(C) La computación en la nube hará que el ser humano ya no sea el único propietario del conocimiento
(D) La forma clásica de acumulación de conocimientos será sustituida por el almacenamiento en Internet
Spanish.context: La búsqueda de información en línea, en lugar del almacenamiento enciclopédico de conocimientos, se está convirtiendo en la norma de la producción de conocimientos. El intento anterior de almacenar conocimientos en el cerebro a través de la memoria individual ha sido derrotado frente a Internet, una forma de almacenamiento ilimitado de información, incluida la computación en la nube. Con la externalización de la sustitución y extracción de la capacidad de la memoria humana por Internet, las personas ya no son propietarias del conocimiento puro, sino creadoras y poseedoras de nuevos conocimientos; toda acumulación de conocimientos clásicos está preparada para la creación y posesión de nuevos conocimientos.

English.answer: (B) Most researchers in climatology have substantial motive to find evidence that would discredit the global warming hypothesis.
choices: (A) Scientists who are skeptical about global warming have not offered any alternative hypotheses to explain climatological data.
(B) Most researchers in climatology have substantial motive to find evidence that would discredit the global warming hypothesis.
(C) There is evidence that conclusively shows that the global warming hypothesis is true.
(D) Research in global warming is primarily driven by a desire for recognition in the scientific community.
English.context: Modern science is built on the process of posing hypotheses and testing them against observations -- in essence, attempting to show that the hypotheses are incorrect. Nothing brings more recognition than overthrowing conventional wisdom. It is accordingly unsurprising that some scientists are skeptical of the widely accepted predictions of global warming. What is instead remarkable is that with hundreds of researchers striving to make breakthroughs in climatology, very few find evidence that global warming is unlikely.

Chinese.context: 一项研究选取80名13岁到25岁出现精神分裂症早期症状的年轻人作为被试对象,随机选取其中一半人服用鱼油片剂3个月,另一半人都用安慰剂3个月.研究人员对受试者跟踪考察7年后发现,在服用鱼油片剂组中,只有10%的人罹患精神分裂症;而在服用安慰剂组中,罹患这种疾病的人则高达40%.由此,研究人员得出结论：服用鱼油片剂有助于青少年预防精神分裂症.

Answer:
Filipino.model_prediction: The correct answer is (A). The passage describes how someone who has a small physical discomfort treats it as a serious illness and constantly seeks medical attention. This behavior is known as the hypochondriac phenomenon. Option A provides an example of this behavior where the person's family members and friends have died young or unexpectedly due to various illnesses, leading them to believe that they too might be suffering from something similar.

Spanish.context: Muchos expertos médicos han sugerido que el consumo excesivo de café es perjudicial para la salud. Para verificar el impacto del consumo excesivo de café en el corazón, los investigadores seleccionaron dos grupos de sujetos. El primer grupo de sujetos bebía cinco o más tazas de café al día y el segundo grupo de sujetos nunca bebía café. Después de un tiempo, se descubrió que la proporción de enfermedades cardíacas en el primer grupo de sujetos era significativamente mayor que en el segundo grupo. Por tanto, los investigadores concluyeron que beber demasiado café aumentaba el riesgo de sufrir enfermedades cardíacas.

Selepas satu tempoh masa, didapati bahawa perkadaran penyakit jantung dalam kumpulan subjek pertama adalah jauh lebih tinggi daripada kumpulan kedua.
